channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Foodwaste bin full of empties outside 89 St Paul’s Road, 28th January
item.description:
This has been here for well over 2 weeks. Please just come and take it away. If you have time to educate the householder on how recycling / foodwaste works and encourage them to use the appropriate containers, that would be a bonus.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25 Victoria Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping lane between Albert St and Victoria St, 28th January
item.description:
Another household treating the street as their dustbin. Loads of black bags of rubbish and other random bin bags, green recycling box full of non recyclables, and just loose rubbish like boxes and packaging. There is no excuse for this. They get weekly bin collections for goodness sake. So tempted to just toss the whole lot back into their garden. Maybe environmental health could pay them a visit/ throw it back in their garden for them to sort out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25 Victoria Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping rear Albert St, 28th January
item.description:
Flytipping in lane between Albert St & Victoria St. I’m sure it’s been reported before but more and more things are being added. Black leather chair, fake Christmas tree, cabinet, plastic garden chairs and more

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Prospect Cottage Albert Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped various items lane between Albert St & Victoria St, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Albert Street, Cheltenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Victoria Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Street lights not working, 28th January
item.description:
Since the new fibre cables were installed the street lights from Aston Grove to Laburnum Court on Springbank Road, Cheltenham are not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Sycamore Court, Cheltenham

item.description:

item.title: Asb, 28th January
item.description:
The entrance to the allotments on Henley Road has become a regular parking spot for ASB. Residents have reported that cars park between the hours of midnight and 3am. The consumption of a large amount of gas from all these cannisters is shocking. Sadly, this is becoming a regular spot for this behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 84 Henley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old settee, bike, shopping basket, 28th January
item.description:
Makes the area look dreadful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 78 Coppice Gate, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping outside 37 Hungerford Street, 28th January
item.description:
The residents of 37 Hungerford Street appear to be using the street as their personal bin, with various carrier bags of unsorted rubbish scattered outside their front door. This is not fair on everyone else who lives here. Please could the public protection team look into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Hungerford Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Drivers failing to stop., 27th January
item.description:
Greyhound Gardens junction Cheltenham Road, drivers in both directions failing to comply with Red lights on Cheltenham Road, every day this happens,it needs cameras to monitor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 256 Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Appalling road surface on a main road, 27th January
item.description:
Several large potholes have now joined together to make the surface literally only suitable for 4x4’s. Been months like this. Urgently needs sorting
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 117 Saint Georges Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on left hand side of the road opposite the entrance to Crickely Hill, 27th January
item.description:
The pothole is deep and when I hit it in the dark, it damaged my alloy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Witcombe
